title: ASL 3.4 ‚Äî Requests & Offers ü§≤
objectives: Make simple requests using CAN, PLEASE, IF-POSSIBLE, WOULD-YOU?
Offer or ask for help with HELP-me / HELP-you (directional verbs)
Respond politely to requests using YES/NO NMM and short answers

vocab.def: Fists move down firmly for CAN; twist head/neg NMM for CAN‚ÄôT
A-hand on palm; moves toward signer for HELP-me, toward partner for HELP-you
Polite open-hand chest circle / chin-out gesture
Soft Y-hand forward; often paired with polite face
IF + POSSIBLE (hands meet in downward motion)
YES: fist nods; NO: index + middle close from thumb
Brows up; slight head tilt for questions

sections.heading: Warm-Up: CAN + HELP
sections.body: Sign **CAN**, **CAN‚ÄôT**, **HELP-me**, **HELP-you**. Focus on direction: toward chest = me, outward = you. Keep fists compact, avoid over-extending.

microCheck.q: Which face matches CAN YOU HELP-me?

sections.heading: Model: Polite Requests
sections.body:
Frames:
‚Ä¢ **CAN YOU HELP-me PLEASE?**
‚Ä¢ **WOULD-YOU READ AGAIN IF-POSSIBLE?**
Keep YES/NO face clear. Add PLEASE or IF-POSSIBLE for polite tone.

microCheck.q: Which makes a request more polite?

sections.heading: Responses: YES / NO + Short Answer
sections.body:
Keep replies short:
‚Ä¢ **YES, HELP.**
‚Ä¢ **NO, CAN‚ÄôT.** (optional reason)
‚Ä¢ **YES PLEASE. THANK-YOU.**

callouts.title: Mini Dialog
callouts.body: A: **CAN YOU HELP-me?** (brows up)  B: **YES PLEASE.**

microCheck.q: Clearer answer to CAN YOU HELP-me?

sections.heading: Partner Practice: Request & Offer Loop
sections.body: A asks **CAN YOU HELP-me?** ‚Üí B answers. Then B asks a new request (e.g., **WOULD-YOU SIGN AGAIN?**). Switch roles. Keep each turn ~20‚Äì30s.

callouts.title: Feedback Stem
callouts.body: ‚ÄúTry brows up more on CAN? / Add PLEASE for polite tone.‚Äù

microCheck.q: Which improves clarity most in requests?

sections.heading: Mini-Showcase
sections.body: Record **10‚Äì15s**: 1 request + 1 response + 1 thank-you. Example: **CAN YOU HELP-me PLEASE?** ‚Üí **YES. HELP. THANK-YOU.**
sections.teacherNote: Offer privacy submission; caption should note how politeness markers (PLEASE, IF-POSSIBLE) helped clarity.
